common_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies step fails with Retry Step message
common_issues.description: Pieces OS Desktop App on Linux fails at "Ensure core dependencies" step after successful initialization. The error message displayed is "Retry Step".  The Gemini API returned a 404 error when attempting to generate a summary. Check Pieces OS logs for more details and ensure network connectivity.

related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate the "Ensure core dependencies" step failure in the Pieces OS Desktop App on Linux. The "Retry Step" message and the Gemini API 404 error suggest potential issues with the dependency installation process and network connectivity.
Prioritize resolution of issue #809, "Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step", as it is currently the only open ticket and has the highest activity level.
Review Pieces OS logs for more details on the "Ensure core dependencies" failure to identify the root cause and potential solutions.
Verify network connectivity and ensure the Pieces OS Desktop App can access necessary resources. Check firewall settings and proxy configurations if applicable.
Investigate the Gemini API 404 error. Ensure the correct model version is being used and that the project has the necessary permissions.
